newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks dip by lunch on rates, merger delay.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks dip by lunch on rates, merger delay.

text.p: Thai stocks eased during thin morning trade on Friday as investors sold bank and finance issues to take profits amid concern over a delayed merger of two financial firms and an uncertain Thai interest rate outlook, brokers said.

"The market was sluggish. Investors preferred to stay on the sidelines waiting for an outcome of the Thai Danu and Finance One talks. They also looked for signs of any interest rate cuts," said Padermpob Songkroh of Nava Finance.
The SET index shed 1.25 points to 580.14 by the lunch break on thin 1.3 billion baht turnover.
"Investors expect to hear announcement (on progress) of the Thai Danu-FinOne alliance this evening," Padermpob said.
Brokers said investors hoped a U.S. Federal Reserve Board decision not to raise interest rates this week would prompt the Thai central bank and commercial banks to cut rates.
Krung Thai Bank topped the active list by lunch, staying unchanged at 30 baht, and United Communication slipped two to 114.
